content: 正则表达式 1. Safari handles positive lookbehind assertions in regular expressions, denoted by (?<=…), abnormally // The following code works fine in Chrome but throws an error in Safari. "https://linlccc.com?theme=light".replace(/(?<=[?|&]theme=)\w+/, "dark"); // The solution is to use capturing groups and string replacement. "https://linlccc.com?theme=light".replace(/([?|&]theme=)\w+/, "$1dark"); // Both of the execution results above are "https://linlccc.com?theme=dark"
